properties.name: AllowIdleReturnWithoutPassword
properties.description: Specifies whether the user must input a PIN or password when the device resumes from an idle state.

properties.name: AllowScreenTimeoutWhileLockedUserConfig
properties.description: Specifies whether to show a user-configurable setting to control the screen timeout while on the lock screen of Windows 10 Mobile devices.

properties.name: AllowSimpleDevicePassword
properties.description: Specifies whether PINs or passwords such as 1111 or 1234 are allowed. For the desktop, it also controls the use of picture passwords.

properties.name: AlphanumericDevicePasswordRequired
properties.description: Determines the type of PIN or password required. This policy only applies if the DeviceLock/DevicePasswordEnabled policy is set to 0

properties.name: DevicePasswordEnabled
properties.description: Specifies whether device lock is enabled.

properties.name: DevicePasswordExpiration
properties.description: Specifies when the password expires (in days).

properties.name: DevicePasswordHistory
properties.description: Specifies how many passwords can be stored in the history that canï¿½t be used.

properties.name: MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock
properties.description: The number of authentication failures allowed before the device will be wiped. A value of 0 disables device wipe functionality.

properties.name: MinDevicePasswordComplexCharacters
properties.description: The number of complex element types (uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation) required for a strong PIN or password.

properties.name: MinDevicePasswordLength
properties.description: Specifies the minimum number or characters required in the PIN or password.

properties.name: ScreenTimeoutWhileLocked
properties.description: Specifies whether to show a user-configurable setting to control the screen timeout while on the lock screen of Windows 10 Mobile devices.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessAccountInfo
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can access account information.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessAccountInfo_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are allowed access to account information. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessAccountInfo policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessAccountInfo_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are denied access to account information. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessAccountInfo policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessAccountInfo_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. The user is able to control the account information privacy setting for the listed Windows apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessAccountInfo policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCalendar
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can access the calendar.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCalendar_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are allowed access to the calendar. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCalendar policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCalendar_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are denied access to the calendar. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCalendar policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCalendar_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. The user is able to control the calendar privacy setting for the listed Windows apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCalendar policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCallHistory
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can access call history.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCallHistory_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are allowed access to call history. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCallHistory policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCallHistory_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are denied access to call history. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCallHistory policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCallHistory_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. The user is able to control the call history privacy setting for the listed Windows apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCallHistory policy setting for the specified Windows apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessCamera_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are denied access to the camera. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessCamera policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are denied access to email. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessEmail policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are denied access to location. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessLocation policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are allowed to read or send messages (text or MMS). This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMessaging policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessMessaging_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are not allowed to read or send messages (text or MMS). This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMessaging policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are denied access to the microphone. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMicrophone policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the microphone privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMicrophone policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessMotion_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are allowed access to motion data. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMotion policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessMotion_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are denied access to motion data. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMotion policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the motion privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessMotion policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can make phone calls

properties.name: LetAppsAccessPhone_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are allowed to make phone calls. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessPhone policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessPhone_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps are not allowed to make phone calls. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessPhone policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessPhone_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the phone call privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessPhone policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessRadios
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps have access to control radios.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessRadios_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will have access to control radios. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessRadios policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessRadios_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will not have access to control radios. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessRadios policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessRadios_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the radios privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessRadios policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can access trusted devices.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will have access to trusted devices. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will not have access to trusted devices. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the 'trusted devices' privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsAccessTrustedDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsSyncWithDevices
properties.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can sync with devices.

properties.name: LetAppsSyncWithDevices_ForceAllowTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will have access to sync with devices. This setting overrides the default LetAppsSyncWithDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsSyncWithDevices_ForceDenyTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. Listed apps will not have access to sync with devices. This setting overrides the default LetAppsSyncWithDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: LetAppsSyncWithDevices_UserInControlOfTheseApps
properties.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows Store Apps. The user is able to control the 'sync with devices' privacy setting for the listed apps. This setting overrides the default LetAppsSyncWithDevices policy setting for the specified apps.

properties.name: AllowProjectionToPC
properties.description:
This policy setting allows you to turn off projection to a PC
							If you set it to 0, your PC isn't discoverable and can't be projected to
							If you set it to 1, your PC is discoverable and can be projected to above the lock screen only. The user has an option to turn it always on or off except for manual launch, too.

properties.name: RequirePinForPairing
properties.description:
This policy setting allows you to require a pin for pairing.
                            If you turn this on, the pairing ceremony for new devices will always require a PIN
                            If you turn it off or don't configure it, a pin isn't required for pairing.

properties.name: EmailAddress
properties.description: The email address the user entered during setup. This is the email address that is associated with the Exchange ActiveSync account and it is required.

properties.name: Domain
properties.description: Domain name of the Exchange server

properties.name: AccountIcon
properties.description: Specify the location of the icon associated with the account.

properties.name: AccountType
properties.description: Specify the account type.

properties.name: AccountName
properties.description: The name that refers to the account on the phone.

properties.name: Password
properties.description: A character string that specifies the password for the account.

properties.name: ServerName
properties.description: Specifies the server name used by the account.

properties.name: UserName
properties.description: Specifies the user name for the account.

properties.name: CalendarAgeFilter
properties.description: Specifies the time window used for syncing calendar items to the phone.

properties.name: Logging
properties.description: Specifies whether diagnostic logging is enabled and at what level.

properties.name: MailBodyType
properties.description: Indicates format type of the Email.  Supported values are 0 (none), 1 (text), 2 (HTML), 3 (RTF), and 4 (MIME).

properties.name: MailHTMLTruncation
properties.description: This setting specifies the size beyond which HTML-formatted e-mail messages are truncated when they are synchronized to the mobile phone. The value is specified in KB. A value of -1 disables truncation.

properties.name: MailPlainTextTruncation
properties.description: This setting specifies the size beyond which text-formatted e-mail messages are truncated when they are synchronized to the mobile phone. The value is specified in KB. A value of -1 disables truncation.

properties.name: Schedule
properties.description: Specifies the time until the next sync is performed in minutes.

properties.name: UseSSL
properties.description: Specifies whether SSL is used.

properties.name: MailAgeFilter
properties.description: Specifies the time window used for syncing email items to the phone.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.description: Enables or disables Sync for Email, contacts, calendar, and Tasks.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the content type.

properties.name: MailBodyType
properties.description: Specifies the email body type. HTML or plain

properties.name: MaxMailAgeFilter
properties.description: Specifies the time window used for syncing mail items to the device.

properties.name: EncodedCertificate
properties.description: The base64 Encoded X.509 certificate.

properties.name: EncodedCertificate
properties.description: The base64 Encoded X.509 certificate.

properties.name: EncodedCertificate
properties.description: The base64 Encoded X.509 certificate. Note that though during MDM enrollment, enrollment server could use WAP XML format to add public part of MDM client cert via EncodedCertificate node, properly enroll a client certificate including private needs a cert enroll protocol handle it  or user installs it manually. In WP, the server cannot purely rely on CertificateStore CSP to install a client certificate including private key.

properties.name: ServerURL
properties.description: Specify the cert enrollment server.

properties.name: Challenge
properties.description: Enroll requester authentication shared secret.

properties.name: EKUMapping
properties.description: Specify extended key usages. The list of OIDs are separated by plus â+â.

properties.name: KeyUsage
properties.description: Specify the key usage bits (0x80, 0x20, 0xA0) for the cert.

properties.name: SubjectName
properties.description: Specify the subject name.

properties.name: KeyProtection
properties.description: Specify where to keep the private key.

properties.name: RetryDelay
properties.description: When the SCEP server sends pending status, specify device retry waiting time in minutes.

properties.name: RetryCount
properties.description: When the SCEP sends pending status, specify device retry times.

properties.name: TemplateName
properties.description: Certificate Template Name OID (As in AD used by PKI infrastructure.

properties.name: KeyLength
properties.description: Specify private key length (RSA).

properties.name: HashAlgrithm
properties.description: Client create Cert enroll request, get supported hash OIalgorithm from SCEP server  and  match it with one specified in this parameter.

properties.name: CAThumbPrint
properties.description: Specify root CA thumbprint.

properties.name: SubjectAlternativeNames
properties.description: Specify subject alternative name. Multiple alternative names could be specified by this node. Each name is the combination of name format+actual name. Each pair is separated by semi-comma.

properties.name: ValidPeriodUnit
properties.description: Specify valid period unit type.

properties.name: RenewPeriod
properties.description: Specify the number of days prior to the enrollment cert expiration to prompt the user to renew.

properties.name: ServerURL
properties.description: Optional. Specifies the cert renewal server URL which is the discovery server.

properties.name: RetryInterval
properties.description: Optional. This parameter specifies retry interval when previous renew failed (in days). It applies to both manual cert renewal and ROBO cert renewal. Retry schedule will stop at cert expiration date.

properties.name: ROBOSupport
properties.description: Optional. Notify the client whether enrollment server supports ROBO auto certificate renew. NOTE: This flag is only needed to the device which is MDM enrolled via On-premise authentication method. For MDM enrolled with federated authentication, ROBO is the only supported renewal method. If the server sets this node value to be false or delete this node for federated enrolled device, the configuration will fail with OMA DM error code 405.

properties.name: EncodedCertificate
properties.description: The base64 Encoded X.509 certificate

properties.name: EncodedCertificate
properties.description: The base64 Encoded X.509 certificate.

properties.name: KeyLocation
properties.description:
Required for PFX certificate installation. Indicates the KeyStorage provider to target the private key installation to. Supported operations are Get, Add
 Datatype will be int
1- Install to TPM, fail if not present
2 â Install to TPM if present, if not present fallback to Software
3 â Install to software
4 â Install to NGC container whose name is specified

properties.name: ContainerName
properties.description:
Optional. 
Specifies the NGC container name (if NGC KSP is chosen for above node). If this node is not specified when NGC KSP is chosen, enrollment will fail.
Format is chr
Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete and Replace

properties.name: PFXCertBlob
properties.description:
Required. 
CRYPT_DATA_BLOB structure that contains a PFX packet with the exported and encrypted certificates and keys. Add on this node will trigger the addition to the PFX certificate. This requires that all the other nodes under UniqueID that are parameters for PFX installation (Container Name, KeyLocation, CertPassword, fKeyExportable) are present before this is called. This will also set the Status node to the current Status of the operation.
Format is Binary64
Supported operations are Get, Add, Replace
If Add is called on this node and a blob already exists, it will fail. If Replace is called on this node, the certificates will be overwritten.
If Add is called on this node for a new PFX, the certificate will be added. If Replace is called on this node when it does not exist, this will fail.
In other words, using Replace or Add will result in the effect of either overwriting the old certificate or adding a new certificate
CRYPT_DATA_BLOB on MSDN can be found at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa381414(v=vs.85).aspx

properties.name: PFXCertPassword
properties.description:
Required if PFX is password protected.
Password that protects the PFX blob. 
Format is  chr. Supported operations are Add, Get

properties.name: PFXCertPasswordEncryptionType
properties.description:
Optional. Used to specify if the PFX certificate password is encrypted with a certificate.
If the value is 
0 - Password is not encrypted
1- Password is encrypted using the MDM certificate by the MDM server
2 - Password is encrypted by a Custom Certificate by the MDM server. When this value is used here, also specify the custom store name in the PFXCertPasswordEncryptionStore node.
The datatype for this node is int.
Supported operations are Add, Replace

properties.name: PFXKeyExportable
properties.description:
Optional. Used to specify if the private key installed is exportable (can be exported later). The datatype for this node is bool.
Supported operations are Add, Get

properties.name: PFXCertPasswordEncryptionStore
properties.description:
Optional. 
When a value of "2" is contained iin PFXCertPasswordEncryptionType, specify the store name where the certificate for decrypting the PFXCertPassword is stored. 
Datatype is string,
Support operation are Add, Get and Replace.

properties.name: ServerURL
properties.description:
Required for SCEP certificate enrollment. Specify the cert enrollment server. The server could specify multiple server URLs separated by semicolon. 
Format is string. 
Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: Challenge
properties.description: Required for SCEP certificate enrollment. B64 encoded SCEP enrollment challenge. Format is chr. Supported operations are Get, Add, Replace, Delete. Challenge will be deleted shortly after the Exec command is accepted.

properties.name: EKUMapping
properties.description:
Required. Specify extended key usages. Subjected to SCEP server configuration. The list of OIDs are separated by plus â+â. Sample format: OID1+OID2+OID3.

Format is chr. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: KeyUsage
properties.description:
Required for enrollment. Specify the key usage bits (0x80, 0x20, 0xA0, etc.) for the certificate in decimal format. The value should at least have second (0x20) or forth (0x80) or both bits set. If the value doesnât have those bits set, configuration will fail.

Format is int. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: SubjectName
properties.description: Required. Specify the subject name. Format is chr. Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: KeyProtection
properties.description:
Optional. Specify where to keep the private key. Note that even it is protected by TPM, it is not guarded with TPM PIN. 
SCEP enrolled cert doesnât support TPM PIN protection. 
Supported values: 
1 â private key protected by TPM, 

2 â private key protected by phone TPM if the device supports TPM. 
All Windows Phone 8.1 devices support TPM and will treat value 2 as 1 

3 (default) â private key saved in software KSP 

4 â private key protected by NGC. If this option is specified, container name should be specifed, if not enrollment will fail


Format is int. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace

properties.name: RetryDelay
properties.description:
Optional. When the SCEP server sends pending status, specify device retry waiting time in minutes. 

Default value is: 5
The min value is 1. 

Format is int. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete noreplace

properties.name: RetryCount
properties.description:
Optional. Special to SCEP. Specify device retry times when the SCEP sever sends pending status. Format is int. Default value is 3. Max value: the value cannot be larger than 30. If it is larger than 30, the device will use 30.
The min value is 0 which means no retry. Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: TemplateName
properties.description: Optional. OID of certificate template name. Note that this name is typically ignored by the SCEP server, therefore the MDM server typically doesnât need to provide it. Format is chr. Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete.noreplace

properties.name: KeyLength
properties.description:
Required for enrollment. Specify private key length (RSA). Format is int. 

Valid value: 1024, 2048, 4096. For NGC, only 2048 is the supported keylength.

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: HashAlgorithm
properties.description:
Required for enrollment. Hash algorithm family (SHA-1, SHA-2, SHA-3) specified by MDM server. If multiple hash algorithm families are specified, they must be separated via +. 

For NGC, only SHA256 is supported as the supported algorithm

Format is chr. 
Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: CAThumbprint
properties.description:
Required. Specify root CA thumbprint. It is a 20-byte value of the SHA1 certificate hash specified as a hexadecimal string value. When client authenticates SCEP server, it checks CA cert from SCEP server whether match with this cert. If not match, fail the authentication. 
Format is chr. 
Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: SubjectAlternativeNames
properties.description:
Optional. Specify subject alternative name. Multiple alternative names could be specified by this node. Each name is the combination of name format+actual name. Refer name type definition in MSDN. Each pair is separated by semicolon. E.g. multiple SAN are presented in the format of [nameformat1]+[actual name1];[name format 2]+[actual name2]. 

Format is chr. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

properties.name: ValidPeriod
properties.description:
Optional. Specify the units for valid period. Valid values are: Days(Default), Months, Years. 
Format is chr. 
Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

NOTE: The device only sends the MDM server expected certificate validation period (ValidPeriodUnits + ValidPerio) the SCEP server as part of certificate enrollment request. It is the serverâs decision on how to use this valid period to create the certificate.

properties.name: ValidPeriodUnits
properties.description:
Optional. Specify desired number of units used in validity period. Subjected to SCEP server configuration. Default is 0. The units are defined in ValidPeriod node. Note the valid period specified by MDM will overwrite the valid period specified in cert template. For example, if ValidPeriod is days and ValidPeriodUnits is 30, it means the total valid duration is 30 days. 

Format is int. 

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete, Replace.

NOTE: The device only sends the MDM server expected certificate validation period (ValidPeriodUnits + ValidPerio) the SCEP server as part of certificate enrollment request. It is the serverâs decision on how to use this valid period to create the certificate.

properties.name: ContainerName
properties.description:
Optional. 
Specifies the NGC container name (if NGC KSP is chosen for above node). If this node is not specified when NGC KSP is chosen, enrollment will fail.

Format is chr

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete and Replace

properties.name: CustomTextToShowInPrompt
properties.description:
Optional. Specifies the custom text to show on the NGC PIN prompt during certificate enrollment. The admin can choose to provide more contextual information for why the user needs to enter the PIN and what the certificate will be used for through this.

Format is chr

Supported operations are Get, Add, Delete and Replace
